tag_list: mashaper, developer, writer, traveller, globe-trotter, speaker, food-lover, api-fanatic
overview:
Marco Palladino is a passionate software developer and entrepreneur in the Web industry, with focus on enterprise and cloud services.

He started coding at the age of 13, since then he has joined several open source projects, contributing to the Java documentation and deepening his passion in microprocessor and circuits development.

He’s been co-founder at MemboxX, an online service for storing documents and small piece of personal data (like telephone numbers and credit card numbers).

Then he co-founded Mashape, the first API marketplace where developers can distribute and consume any kind of cloud components. The company got an angel round from early Youtube employees in 2010, and a 1.5M seed round from top Silicon Valley investors. Mashape has been launched on November 2010, and after a Beta period, is now open to everyone.
